website_summaries.verdict: The Ultra extends Fitbit's already impressive personal fitness data measurement abilities, but for the same $99.95 price. Already a high-tech pedometer, the Ultra now has an altimeter to record stairs climbed, too. It isn't as advanced as more expensive mobile fitness gadgets, but the tiny device is easy to wear all day long and fun to use.
pros: Small, light, and easy to carry, the Fitbit Ultra effortlessly tracks your basic daily activity level
It has a host of online analytical tools, it tracks sleep quality, and it boasts both Android and iOS mobile apps
cons: The Fitbit Ultra needs to be within 15 feet to sync with its USB-connected base station
The Trainer feature and a deeper activity data analysis cost extra

customer_reviews.title: "1,035,177 total lifetime steps" as of this morning.
customer_reviews.text: One million steps in seven months. The only way I know that number is because of my Fitbit recording it and sending the data to the company website and storing it for me. Thanks Fitbit, you work as advertised for me, and that's all I need say. ============= Update: 28 May 2013 as of this morning 2,145,743 steps and 1027.21 miles total in 14 months of use, Fitbit recording at their site. Any problems have been with synch being wonky at times and not recording instantly which is an annoyance because of my impatience. Battery still charges and holds charge but seems to drain quicker, I expect this is the weak point in the system.
customer_reviews.author: Konrad.

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe it stopped working days JUST after warranty expired!
customer_reviews.text: They have so much control over reading the data on this device, and it automatically updates itself, it would seem they could reset it or something. It will no longer charge. And it was 367 days after I installed it to my computer and started using it. I have gotten very quick (generic) responses from Fitbit, but they continually say the warranty has expired and want me to purchase a new model at a discount. It doesn't seem like they should be so disposable. It also seems like they might last just a little longer than the 367 days. Hmmmmm..... I won't give them another $100 for another year. I can buy a lot of pedometers for $100.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Compelling little device - FANTASTIC customer service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these at the beginning of May. From the start, I really enjoyed this device and how it worked with lots of other programs like 'myfitnesspal" for instance. It really helped me monitor my activity levels and adjust calories accordingly. It basically made me become more mindful of my body in general. I am actually in withdrawel right now becauise I accidentially washed and dried the fitbit a few weeks ago. I figured I was out the $100 but I contacted customer service and they offered a one time stupidity replacement, which I greatly appreciate!
customer_reviews.author: Judith E. Golden

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this one for a friend of mine after she saw mine. I love these and wonder what I did before. I have always had trouble with traditional pedometers not working for me, maybe I don't jiggle enough when I walk but this works great, and I especially love the sleep tracker. I have discovered that I need 9 hours in bed to get 8 hours of sleep so this has changed the way I go to bed and I feel better for it. I also like the fact that you can keep track of your friends progress too, it makes it more fun and keeps you motivated to do more each day. YES YES GET ONE!!
customer_reviews.author: Diane L Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little gadget!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Fitbit! I have a Polar heart rate monitor (the kind with a strap) and a Bodybugg - and the Fitbit BY FAR outshines them both in comparison! It's small, non-binding, seems to be pretty darn accurate, and it does SO many things. I love the fact that it syncs with My Fitness Pal. The calories burned automatically updates/adjusts in MFP. And if you track your calories consumed, you can enter it into MFP and the calorie totals will auto-sync with Fitbit's site. It also shows calories burned during sleep!!! Even though I'm not very impressed (yet) with the sleep tracker, I am still giving this 5 stars. I never leave home without it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Sullens

customer_reviews.title: Nifty little gadget.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking at a Garmin Forerunner because I'm a beginning runner and wanted to track distance. But they're huge and pricey. I looked at other simple small fitness trackers but FitBit seemed like the most unobtrusive. It is tiny, and I really like the wireless uploading. I wear it all the time and love tracking my steps. Not sure i trust the calorie counter, and I use sparkpeople.com for food tracking, but for tracking steps, distance and sleep, I love it. It's not fancy or feature packed, but for a beginner who wants something better than a pedometer, I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeni B.

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best purchases I have ever made. It may be more expensive than what you may be looking at, but it's worth it. I am a "big" girl, and I always had problems with accuracy on the pedometers that are worn at the waist. I have tried the ankle peds too...not that accurate, and probably dangerous for those around me when it comes flying off my ankle! This fits in my bra, and really seems to keep track of everything. It's small, and it's good looking. It helps keep me motivated too...I am always keeping it over 10K, and am lost if I forget to wear it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: FitBit ~ great tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the FitBit wireless activity tracker in plum. It has inspired me to improve my activity level as well as eat healthier! So far I have walked over 250 miles. It is easy to use, keeps it's charge for quite a few days, and links to my laptop seamlessly. I enjoy the upbeat prompts it gives me and the feedback via email on my progress. I highly recommend getting a FitBit. It is more than a pedometer. It is a mini lifestyle coach :) I wear in securely on my bra. Never had a problem with it falling off or even coming loose. It even still looks brand new !
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Compared to the Jawbone..Fitbit wins.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried both the Fitbit and Jawbone Up and prefer the fitbit. Things I like about the Fitbit: -Display -Size (can be hidden) -Customer service- They actually sent me a free one after I lost mine. Jawbone has the absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced. -It is more accurate than the Jawbone. Very cool product that has been useful in keeping me active. The only thing I would suggest is adding a lanyard and clipping on you so it does not accidentally get lost. I made a little one with 550 cord and a clip and it works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service, item has vulnerabilities
customer_reviews.text: I bought my Fitbit several months ago. I am really on my second one. It fell off while I was walking. I emailed the company and they sent me a replacement at no charge. That is what I call great customer service. It is refreshing to work with a company that is responsive like that. My device is having issues syncing right now, but the company is again being very responsive. I expect to work out a satisfactory solution with them soon. I would purchase the item for that if nothing else. It really does motivate you to walk too.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Sundeen

customer_reviews.title: Holy Crap, I Just Washed Mine
customer_reviews.text: 5/4/2012 Had it for about a month and my fear that I would forget it on my pants and wash it has been realized. Went through a full cycle with warm water and about 10 minutes in the dryer and.............amazingly it still works! I really like it and will give an update soon as to whether it continues to function but as of now BRAVO FitBit. Half a week since I washed/dried it and no problems so far. Still working fine. 5/31/2012 - Still working fine. It is easy to forget on your pants/shorts. Almost washed it again.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Great steps/activity tracker
customer_reviews.text: A friend recommended this little podometer to me, and it's so much more than that! There is a website that you can use with the device. On it, you can log your weight, the foods you eat all day, your activities, your body fat, and your steps and so much more. I love this little Fitbit. The dashboard page is free, unless you want to pay for their trainer. You can customize your training and/or weight loss goals. Its beome my obsession!! The encouragement you get from both the little device, and from seeing how far you've come makes you just want to keep going.
customer_reviews.author: Flower Power

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: If you are a competitive person this is a great item. I have had a fitbit since August 2011 and it is a very motivational little tool. I am always wanting to exceed my previous records for stairs, miles walked, and number of steps taken. The food tracking part of the web interface is a very good way to keep calorie intake within your desired range. The only issue I have is that I am on my third unit (through no fault of the item); I washed one and crushed another with a dumbbell. Obviously, I like the fitbit since I keep replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Gunther

customer_reviews.title: I love my FitBit!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the FitBit just over two weeks ago and started walking each morning. I am averaging just over 19,000 steps a day...almost 2X my daily goal. Prior to purchasing the FitBit I would estimate that I was only getting in 5K to 6K steps on a daily basis. I linked my "myfitnesspal" account to my fitBit dashboard and I have found this to be a huge plus. I can monitor my calories burned verse calories consumed which makes it easy to manage a daily deficit. I have already lost 7 lbs and I feel so much better! I highly recommend this great little gadget!!!!
customer_reviews.author: noelty

customer_reviews.title: Too easy to run through the washing machine..
customer_reviews.text: Not sure it's fair to blame the Fitbit, but we have had 3 of our Fitbits go through a full wash cycle then tumble dry. They don't survive the treatment and only partially work after coming out. Usually they wont sync anymore despite resets etc. Because of their size, It's way to easy for them to be left in a pile of clothes and run thru a clean cycle. They should be made much more robust i.e. waterproof and should be able to withstand the tumble cycles. I wonder how many other people have had the same thing happen.
customer_reviews.author: alchemyiam

customer_reviews.title: Wear it every day!
customer_reviews.text: It has been several months since I purchased this item, and I love it. I wear everyday and try to challenge myself to do better for overall health. Really handy to use and love it when I do Zumba! Only downfall is the band to wear at night. The Velcro irritates my wrist. Suggest going to a fabric store and purchase either a terry cloth or fleece material to make one to slip on your wrist. Yes, I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: FitBit Black/Blue Wireless Activity Tracker
customer_reviews.text: This first generation FitBit suffers from breakage after a while. It's a shame because the FitBit is an awesome item. If you're considering the FitBit, consider the FitBit One or the FitBit that goes on the wrist. The case on this one cracked on BOTH FitBits I bought, but FitBit was great about replacing the first FitBit. The FitBit might occasionally over estimate your steps, but in the grand scheme of things, it's not the worst thing ever. It's still more accurate than most other pedometers.
customer_reviews.author: Micky

customer_reviews.title: That extra motivation.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fitbit. I've used other calorie and activity tracking services before. While they offered a nice way to track my calories they didn't give me the motivation I needed to push harder. The fitbit gives me all the data I want and syncs automatically. I have upgraded to the premium account to get more data. I also enjoy looking at how many calories I've burned through the day. I find the sleep tracker very nice. It works great and I can use that data to help sleep better. I highly recommend this to people who find that having more data gives them more motivation.
customer_reviews.author: Migizi

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have now had this device for two weeks and I love it. I got the device and altho I read the reviews I didnt really have an opinion either way going into it. My biggest curiousity was to see how it measured my sleep and I am pleasantly surprised by what it's telling me. It has answered a question that has puzzled me and has confirmed something my doctor has been wondering about so in a way it's bettered my health. It's interesting to see how active I am during the day as well. I'm not the couch potato that I thought I was becoming! lol
customer_reviews.author: Deborah D. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the Fitbit F004 and now all they do is flash F414 when they are on the charger. I was never able to use either Fitbit or get them to work. I finally bought a Fitbit one replacement and that works perfectly. Just kind of disappointed I was not able to use them. If they worked I would give them to my husband to help him track his many steps every day.
customer_reviews.author: Spirit of VAF

customer_reviews.title: Very nice design but imprecise and the novelty wears off
customer_reviews.text: This is a gorgeous little product, and amazingly simple to use. BUT, I've compared its results to treadmill readings and various vehicular odometers and pedometers and it can be off from 10% to 50% compared to known distances. Results vary based on where I attach the unit to my body. It just isn't accurate. But it's helpful when scoping out new hiking trails to see how many vertical feet and miles each trail is compared to other trails I've measured with the same device. Also, once the novelty wore off I barely ever use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: BeamerJaws

customer_reviews.title: It counts your steps!
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to look at this throughout the day and see how my progress is. It tells me when the battery is getting low. You can easily clip it onto your pants, belt, or bra. The Fitbit tracker website is easy to use, you can see graphs over a whole month and compete with friends and family. I recently tried a Fitbit Flex, but I missed being able to see the numbers whenever I wanted (the flex just has lights). I would recommend this Fitbit to everybody, just don't lose it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Best BEST tracking exercise device
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE FITBIT. Fitbit is the best exercise tracking device.I like the fact that it works indoors and basically any where you go. It just keeps going. The fitbit lasts for up to 7 days and then you must recharge it. I would highly recommend it if you want to walk/run more and even loose weight. Although I have lost my first very first fitbit in a park somewhere. It some how came out of the clip. Costume care gave me new one at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise aid!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product to help become more active. I don't think it is for the marathon runners or people that are very active and fit. It is perfect for those of us that need a push to set goals and be held accountable. The online support tracks food and exercise (as much as you are willing to use it). A friend of mine has used it for 2012 and lost over 70 pounds. I have lost 10 pounds and become much more active in the 3 months since I began using it. I highly recommend it! Cons: this unit is not waterproof and you have to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: jbajat

customer_reviews.title: Best workout tool ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best workout tool I have ever owned! I used to go to the YMCA and was hooked on Fitlinxx which tracks your workouts, weight lifted, etc. at the gym. Although fitbit doesn't actually track your weight lifting, you have to enter that "activity" manually, I like it better than Fitlinxx because it's not strictly tied to your workouts at the gym, it's with you everywhere tracking all your steps, floors climbed, etc. and you can manually enter workouts it can't measure. I had a couple of scares where I'd misplaced it when changing clothes and realized how addicted I am to it. I LOVE my fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Livian

customer_reviews.title: Works great, BUT!!
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it says it does. And it works great! But, I have two they have both failed within eight months. The housings on both of them cracked. Then they fail to charge and failed to keep track of anything. Hopefully the new one coming out on 15 May 2013 will fix always problem it's worn on the wrist, and is waterproof. I already have it on preorder and can't wait to get it. The ultra has a one-year warranty and hopefully I can get mine replaced, we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf.the-grey

customer_reviews.title: Broken a few months after the warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: There is a design flaw with the Ultra. The casing just doesn't hold up if you use it as intended (e.g. actually clipping it to clothing). I'm sure Fitbit is aware of this issue but their warranty is only good for a year. Another family members broke the exact same way. When I look at the new fitbits they have eliminated this weak point. I just wish the company would subsidize a replacement. It's a shame to spend this on something that just doesnt last.
customer_reviews.author: thehigz

customer_reviews.title: I live by this device
customer_reviews.text: This Fitbit tracker really helps me keep the pace up. I use it daily and it is more accurate than the chip in these late model phones. Having this device for a couple of years, then losing it, I felt like I was walking around without my wallet - that's how important it is to me. Looking at the stats daily, I've found that I climb stairs more often than I used to, I walk a lot more and am better able to meet my daily goals for activity. Coming from sedentary lifestyle, this has really helped me escape and become more mobile!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I love FitBit, but they are so difficult to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: I love FitBit, but they are so difficult to keep track of and avoid washing. I had this one for about two years and finally just washed it and it's dead. My wife has washed two and lost another one. I'm pretty much just giving up now. Despite the human failure aspect, the system is great, and I'm going to miss it.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Beach

customer_reviews.title: Love it....and provides great incentive
customer_reviews.text: Could it be simpler? Attach it to my bra or night shirt and away we go. I am able to monitor my activity daily and see what I need to do next to meet my goals but also monitor my sleep. Sleep has been an issue since returning from overseas and this really helps me monitor if my night time patterns are getting off. I have convinced at least two other friends to get one and plan one for my fit conscious 30 year old daughter for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Indiamike

customer_reviews.title: Great device!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tracker, it keeps track of stairs, steps, calories, activity, sleep. I have had this for 17 months and it just keeps going even though I have washed and dried it a few times (not recommended) dropped it and banged it around, pretty tough. The wireless sync and the program work well. It is a little expensive for a pedometer, but I wanted to track my stairs and like the integration with the online programs.
customer_reviews.author: Dynarider

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I love the websight and food log. I eat out a LOT and all i have to do is type in why I ate it and automadically finds the item, the resturant and cal. count for the item. It tells me if I have not drank enough water and how mush fiber, protein and sodium I've taken in. The actual device is very discreet and easy to use. Just download the software for free online and your good to go. It shows how many steps I need to do. It's good to have a goal. I really will enjoy this! <3
customer_reviews.author: Leah Vavra

customer_reviews.title: The Motivator
customer_reviews.text: I was the last of my family to get a Fitbit but I've worn it non stop since the day it arrived. Anyone needing a little motivation to get up and be more active this is the product for you. It is very easy to use. No programming required and with a touch of a button you can see your step/calorie burn count. The sleep band works great and reports the quantity and quality of each nights sleep. The Fitbit community is very incouraging and you will start exercising more just to see your numbers improve. This is a great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Sugg

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't for me.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer my Polar Watch and Myfitnesspal App. I don't feel this was that accurate. I sold it the same week I bought it and took a loss because I didn't want to have to go online to log stuff. Couldn't figure out how to link it with MFP, so now I use the app to scan my food and my polar watch to track exercise calories.
customer_reviews.author: Innovater

customer_reviews.title: An amazing little device!
customer_reviews.text: I've been logging my food for a couple of weeks with the Fitbit.com food log and debating about investing in the actual device. I've had it for a couple of days now and I LOVE it. It's even smaller than I imagined and fits on my bra without being noticeable at all, and wearing it makes me aware of how often I'm "sedentary" (mostly because it puts it all in a pie chart). It's the motivation I needed to get back in shape! And it's so easy to use!! I absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JustineEmily

customer_reviews.title: Wish I still had my fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit is wonderful, however it gets lost very easily because of it's small size. I owned my for about a year before losing it, which after telling the company they replaced it once for me, free of charge with a refurbished one. After about 6 months the refurbished one died. I do not care for the newer models so won't be buying again (too expensive, too easy to lose or damage)
customer_reviews.author: Aurora M

customer_reviews.title: Great if you commit to where it
customer_reviews.text: I love Fitbit but you really need to make wearing it a part of your daily routine. In the beginning I wore it all the Imelda, but after forgetting a few times I stopped using it. Device works great but for $100 you really need to be the type of person that will make it part of your daily routine. Might be worth starting with a free mobile app to see if you can really committed. Also be careful you remove it before washing clothes!
customer_reviews.author: TaraB

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Pedometer
customer_reviews.text: This is great as a pedometer. It syncs to the web wirelessly, etc., but don't buy into their claim that it's good for tracking sleep. It isn't. Also, the online tools aren't as awesome as they could be with a little more work - they LOOK great, but their calculations aren't always accurate. All in all it's not a bad product, but it's certainly overpriced and does not deliver on everything it promises. If/when this dies, I'll be looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: R. Blacker

customer_reviews.title: Great help in getting and keeping me moving1
customer_reviews.text: I find just wearing the Fitbit makes me more conscious of my need to walk more - and I have been using the stairs more too - all of which is contributing to helping me stay strong and breathe easier. I am a senior citizen and am delighted with this tool. I have already found my stamina has increased as well as the fact I am sleeping better - due to my walking more - I am really delighted with my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: High Tech Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Recommend Fitbit. Small, easy and records activities.
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of the fitbit. I wear it all the time and I love that it records how I sleep. I do not like wearing things on my wrist or arm so the smallness of the fitbit is great. The fibit website is helpful and easy to navigate. The only recommendation is that when you exercise DO NOT wear it that it can get moisture/wet. Over a period of time, I wore my fitbit by my skin and it got too much moisture and did not work as well but the company is sending me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a gift and it was a hit! It is very tiny and even tells the time! I was originally looking for a watch to log calories and track workout data. This gadget greatly exceeded my expectations. I believe it has an iphone app to enter food information into. It keeps track of steps, stairs, miles and more. It is easy to use even for the technically challenged. The online website is also a great tool and very easy to use. Thank you fitbit!
customer_reviews.author: Cariann Pafford

customer_reviews.title: Not per expectations
customer_reviews.text: My biggest disappointment was we never could get it to read measurements when my father was asleep. This was a gift for my father, and he was happy about tracking his steps. Although, he still mentions it is not consistent, but overall close to accurate. The size is the steal, it can be carried around without being a burden. Sleek look too is good. That it can wirelessly communicate to the computer is also neat, but again my father does not find that to be consistent.
customer_reviews.author: RTOAC

customer_reviews.title: Best fitness device
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase to upgrade an existing fitbit which was purchased right when they came out. This is probably the best fitness device you can get for overall tracking. If you don't know how much you did the day before you don't know how much you can do today. The new unit can track stairs which is a nice edition. There are really no negatives for this product it does what it needs to do and does it very well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit is great when it's working.
customer_reviews.text: I went through 2 of them. First once died about 6 months in, and the second one died about 4 months in. I've given up and am switching to the jawbone. I even had the scale for my fitbit, which was really nice. It was great to get consistent readings and have it fed right to your exercise tracking system. I really loved fitbit but yah, guess they're not built for a little sweat when stored on the bra strap. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: R. DeCato

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I love this little gem. It really motivates me to get moving. The online tracking is great. I did have a probelm when it quit working after it got to wet. I was wearing it on my bra and had a neoprene kutting shirt on and got a little to wet, after a 2 hour heavy workout. The company was great and sent me a new unit. I was lost with out it until I got my new one. I am careful not to put it in my shirt when I plan a heavy work out and it really work great.
customer_reviews.author: RJD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and bought one for myself at the same time to encourage his use. The only difficulty he had was in keeping up with his. But, even he, who has a Kindle that is several years old and yet to be used (!) found this simple to use and enjoyable. Eventually, he left it on clothes that went in the wash. It survived the first trip through the laundry, but not the second.
customer_reviews.author: CPickens

customer_reviews.title: fitbit ultra
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say this thing was here within a matter of 2 days,now that is super fast delivery. I cannot post much on this yet other than to say it is very small(which is good),you don't notice you are wearing it. The set-up was very quick and easy.I also notice as of now it doesn't track little movements like a pedometer does,so on that note I would have to say I love this thing and think it is very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: sherrie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love the fitbit
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pedometer I have ever had/used. It works well and is accurate no matter where you hook it e.g. pocket, shirt collar, etc. The only negative I have for this product is the Fitbit website. While it is an OK website I have migrated to the "my fitness Pal" website, The good news is you can link your fitbit account to the my fitness pal website so you don't lose any of the functionality of either website.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tool
customer_reviews.text: First the shipper of this product, seller, did a great job, thank you. So far I have only touched the basics of what this can do, but I already find myself challenging myself and others I have linked with to take it another step each day. I see this as being a valuable tool in helping to better gauge my activity levels and to encourage myself and others with the FitBit to challenge each other and become more fit.
customer_reviews.author: RevSpongeBobSP

customer_reviews.title: It really motivates me!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Fitbit - but not very happy that in less than 4 weeks after I ordered mine, there is a new model coming out and the one I ordered is $20 cheaper - so really bummed about that... But love watching my steps go up and up and especially love the sleep tracker - a great motivater...getting me physically back on track !!!! Soon my two daughters will each have their own fitbit and than by linking up, I know we will really motivate each other!!
customer_reviews.author: Diane E. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I started using this at the beginning of the summer as motivator. I LOVE IT! I have had to replace it once because it just isn't water proof and my old one fell in water and I couldn't retrieve it quickly enough. It may not be perfect but it is the easiest and most accurate pedometer and calorie counter I've ever used. There is just no cheating this thing and it is a constant motivator to STAY ACTIVE! Kudos to the creators.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cope

customer_reviews.title: KEEPS ME ON TRACK FOR WEIGHT LOSS
customer_reviews.text: This device is a wonderful way to really keep track of your daily activity movements. I use it from the time I get out of bed to the time I am back in.I have been very focused on weight loss this year and Fitbit lets me know how much I have burned vs how much I have taken in in calories. I love to show my doctor my weekly progress report that I receive in an email. Every week it shows that I have push myself a little bit farther!
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I like the way it keeps count of my steps and calories burned. The on-line site is great allowing user to enter food eaten and calculate daily calories in v out. The only feature that does not seem to work well for me is keeping track of my sleep. As long as I am still, it thinks I'm asleep. Customer service, by email only, has responded in a timely manner when I've had a problem downloading my info.
customer_reviews.author: T Cris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gadget to keep you healthy!
customer_reviews.text: My wife purchased the Fitbit for me on my 41st birthday, mainly because she knows how much of a gadget geek I am. Since I started using it in October of 2011, I have lost 23 pounds. But the most important part is that I feel great. It really works for me because it helps motivate me to walk 10k steps a day, even when I don't feel like it. I have no complaints about this product and I would recommend it to anyone looking to get in shape.
customer_reviews.author: C. Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Best Tracker Ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I wear my FitBit every day and love it!! Whenever I check it throughout the day I find myself wanting to push my numbers up, and if I'm relatively close to the 10,000 steps I will do a couple of laps around the house to reach that goal! I don't regularly use the sleep tracker feature, and would prefer if it didn't show calories burned when I'm not wearing it through the night, but that's minor. The only other improvement would be better tracking when doing exercise videos such as kick boxing or strength training.
customer_reviews.author: Cristine

customer_reviews.title: Best multi-function tracker EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my Fitbit tracker since April 2012, LOVE IT! It's the most accurate device I have ever used and certainly the most versatile. The sleep tracking function is most critical for me. I can log in from my Doctor's office and show her how well I am doing with my activity level and the quality of sleep I am getting which has been an issue. Fitbit makes my life so much easier, and the online support is wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Amythearose

customer_reviews.title: Measured distances not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for almost a month, and use it most days. I tried using the default setting for my height, and then tried the measured stride length setting (based on number of strides walking around a 440 track), but I have yet to get accurate recordings of distance. It overstates distance by 50 to 100 percent. It also is too sensitive: I took a train ride where I sat the whole time, but when I got off it recorded that I took 800 steps. The idea is great, but the execution is poor.
customer_reviews.author: tborr123

customer_reviews.title: Love it - really works!
customer_reviews.text: I got my fitbit after christmas recently in order to help motivate myself to walk more. It really works! It's a great motivational tool - counting your steps and stairs really push you to say "I can do 1000 more steps" or "I can do 5 more floors of stairs". The sleep tracking function is an added bonus. Battery lasts a long time, I only have to charge it about twice a week. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CP seattle

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my fitbit!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my fitbit back in August and didn't really know all that it was capable of. After using it a couple of nights, I bought my husband and daughter one and showed my sister the website and she went and bought one. Within a month, her husband bought one. They are addicting! I can easily see myself wearing this forever! It is great for competition!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly List

customer_reviews.title: fitbit, fun and functional
customer_reviews.text: I have only 2 negatives about the fitbit, the calorie counter does not go to zero overnight and rather difficult trying to read outdoors in the sunlight. Good points are, it keeps me motivated with adding all the leaves and earning badges which for me is a bonus. Great motivational words every time I pick the device up. Also like the fact that I don't have to attach to my pants or skirt and is virtually hidden from view. Also like how compact it is and I don't accidentally hit a button and erase anything like I have done with my old phone.
customer_reviews.author: sasegram

customer_reviews.title: Has a few problems
customer_reviews.text: It is susceptible to small amounts of sweat. Must keep it from touching skin if you sweat much during workouts, or even during the day. It will only record one day, and only one sleep session, if you sleep more than one period in the day. Miss a day of activity and it doesn't synch up or you don't put it on the home base, you lose that day's data. Some of the effort to reach different badges are too large to bridge over to get them decently. It's good to get the data to try and motivate yourself towards doing something.
customer_reviews.author: No one

customer_reviews.title: Seller sold obsolete inventory to me
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a Fitbit ultra wireless activity + sleep tracker for a Christmas gift. Its description said it came with a one year warranty, it did not work and the manufacturer said it was so old and taken off the market years ago that it was no longer supported by Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy tool - great motivator
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit! I don't use the food tracker since I'm doing Weight Watchers, but it has really made me aware of how many steps I'm taking and it makes me want to do more. I want those badges! I'm taking breaks from my desk to climb the stairs in my building and parking in the back of the parking lot. I know I should've been doing these things anyway, but this little tool has helped me to find the motivation!
customer_reviews.author: C. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Support
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about 3 weeks and I really like the product. It does everything I expected as advertised. You have to calibrate it to your stride length although the default isn't far off. Any emails to tech support were answered promptly within about 4-8 hours and the quality of the answers were very good. It integrated with Lose-it.com which makes it a solid part of my fitness and health plan.
customer_reviews.author: Rex RFN

customer_reviews.title: Sync problems
customer_reviews.text: I liked the features of the device, it seemed to do a good job of logging activity, I especially liked the sleep monitoring function. Unfortunately my device had synchronization issues, to get the Fitbit to upload data each time I had to unplug and re-plug the base station, then attach and remove the Fitbit from the base station multiple times. I returned the device as defective and I do not think I would take the chance on another.
customer_reviews.author: D. W. W.

customer_reviews.title: best fitness purchase made
customer_reviews.text: I bought my fitbit about a month ago and it is the best fitness purchase I have ever made! I just LOVE it. I love how I now push to do more floors to earn my next badge or reach the summit of a mountain (on one of the groups I am in on the fitbit site). The integrated site is what makes this the best! Also, fitbit integrates with myfitnesspal.com, so even better! Love, love, love the fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my FitBit
customer_reviews.text: I received my FitBit as a birthday present - wondering what in the world it was! It has made my walking exercise so much more fun. My daughter and son-in-law each have one and we watch each other's daily activities, with a competitive spirit. Watching the sleep-time activity is also interesting. I like the fact that I can just get close to my computer and it picks up all the information from the FitBit so I can see it instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The fitbit is truely an awesome little device. I love how it tracks your sleep pattern by any movements in the middle of the night. I found the device to be quite accurate and can be placed on your jeans/workout gear with ease. It's not bulky or anything, and i love that it's digital and wireless.
customer_reviews.author: ForeverYoung

customer_reviews.title: Great device, much more than a pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I wear my fitbit all day and all night and I've had it for quite a while now. I enjoy seeing my patterns of movement and eating. I can see what times of the day or days of the week, I am inactive and that helps me to change my exercise habits. I also really like looking at my sleep and using sleepdebt to calculate how many hours I'm ahead or behind. It's a great device and a highly recommend it to everyone, I've ordered an Aria to go with it, which will add a new burst of excitement to my Fitbit.
customer_reviews.author: Emm

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability
customer_reviews.text: I wore this product while walking, jogging, and working out and it died less than 10 days after I bought it. Simply stopped working and recording activity. Amazon was nice and swapped it for a new unit. Now, less than 6 weeks later, the same problem is cropping up. At first, I simply couldn't see the activity information on the unit itself, though it was still recording. Then it stopped syncing the following day. Then it stopped recording altogether. Amazon is being very nice about taking the item back as defective. The second time around, I have no interest in a replacement, as I simply think the product is not durable enough to track activity.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitbit withdrawal
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these babies and got addicted to it. Then I went shopping at Walmart. When I got home, I noticed it had fallen off of the waistband of my jeans. I went back to Walmart and retraced my steps with no luck (wish I could have logged all of those steps!!) Anyway, I have ordered a replacement and will make sure I use the leash or attach it to my bra.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Gengler

customer_reviews.title: Poor poor customer service tech support
customer_reviews.text: I'm having difficulty resetting my password. They have some kind of "Ts" symbol telling you to use it but dont tell what it is! They do not have live support. Their site indicates they will contact me in 48 hours. That's not good enough for me. In my line of work I tend to people's needs stat. I'm an RN. The next time they need the bed pan or something for pain I guess I'll get with them in 48 hrs. Spend your $ elsewhere. In this economy someone will give you much better service AND you can speak to a REAL person in this country during business hours.
customer_reviews.author: Lyne

customer_reviews.title: Broke too easily
customer_reviews.text: I loved my fitbit, may it rest in peace. This original fitbit was genius in everything but physical design. It was super accurate and very easy to sync/charge, the only problem was that I broke two of the fitbit clips and then the fitbit itself broke a panel off within a year. I just purchased the new fitbit one and I would definitely recommend it over the original if you are going to be less than gentle with it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie O

customer_reviews.title: Love the Fitbit
customer_reviews.text: I have been a pedometer user for years and graduated to the Fitbit about 30 days ago. I love it. I love the wireless sync. I love the badges that motivate you. And I absolutely love the sleep monitoring. I've learned a lot in only 30 days about my sleep patterns and the effect of certain activities have on my sleep. If you want a bit of motivation to get you moving, order one today. I've also synced up my Fitbit account to my MyFitnessPal account that I've been using for quite a while to track food. Great way to see intake vs burn.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney J. House

customer_reviews.title: this company is amazing
customer_reviews.text: I think the company that makes fitbit is one of the most ethical group of people I have run across in a long time. When I had an issue and emailed them the response was almost immediate and most satisfactory! This device is a great incentive for people who want to get health.
customer_reviews.author: Susz G

customer_reviews.title: I love my fitbit
customer_reviews.text: A friend purchased one for Xmas and was raving about it. She explained the basic functions such as tracking activity online such as distances walked or ran and I was sold. The dashboard on the website is excellent. It allows you to log food and track your weight. Food log keeps track of calories, fat, fiber, carbs, sodium , protein and water consumed. The activity tracker is great. You can see what you actually do during a work out. My only complaint is that I don't think the calories burned is accurate. There are other logs on the dashbord for sleep, heart rate, blood pressure and glucose that I have not used yet.
customer_reviews.author: Zee

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool for motivation!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit has changed how I approach my day. I purposefully take the stairs, park away from the entrance of stores, and I'm finding more and more motivation to get out and move after work. The calorie tool is amazing - based on your weight goal and daily physical activity, the Fitbit dashboard tells you how many calories you should consume that day. The iPhone app is great too for entering food in the food diary. Sleep function is amazing - I know when I fall asleep and exactly how many times I wake up during the night. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: mammiechelle

customer_reviews.title: FitBit - Its ok.
customer_reviews.text: Fit Bit Ultra. Didnt really know much about the FitBit when I purchased it. On the face of it, it is pretty much a glorified pedometer, monitoring how many steps you take, calories and distance. I think it is over priced for what it does; but on the plus side, it does have a good website where you can monitor what you have done and connect with other users. I dont think I would purchase it again if I knew what I know now. Its basically a glorified digital pedometer.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent exercise aide
customer_reviews.text: I began using fit it as soon as I received it. My experience with it has been great. It tracks steps and stairs accurately and is small enough to be unobtrusive. When combined with the web site calorie tracking and exercise goal setting, it has been useful in sustaining my weight loss activity. The iPhone app is virtually useless however.
customer_reviews.author: Usnav8r

customer_reviews.title: BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this for my birthday four days ago. It took me a day to fall in love with it. It tracked everything and really helped me up my workouts. Then today I attached it to my jeans, just like I've done for the last four days after my workouts, and now it's gone! I can't find it anywhere and I'm devistated! Be careful when you put this on your clothes and when you move around so you won't be as crushed as I am. Maybe a pocket or inside a bra is a better idea than clipping it to the top of pants. Just be aware!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janey L. Mason

customer_reviews.title: So stinking useful!
customer_reviews.text: Fitbit has rescued me from a lull of lacking motivation and overestimating just how much I do per day. I know now how many steps I take, how far I go, how many calories I'm burning vs. how many I take in, it monitors my sleep... I honestly don't know how I would have ever met my weight goal without it now! Two of my friends have one now, so we connected on the Fitbit site and can hold each other accountable - it's like working out with a buddy without the embarrassment or self-consciousness!
customer_reviews.author: Msmegschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pedometer
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my Fitbit. I wear mine everywhere I go and even to sleep so I can track how efficiently I sleep. I accidentally left it in my pants pocket which went through a wash and after syncing it once, it was working again. I like how you can integrate food logs and activity logs for a more accurate calorie count for the day.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: 2 dead fitbits in less than a month!
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of the fitbit and I even loved it when it worked. But less than 2 weeks after I got it, the display died. I got a second one, and the display just died on it too, after less than 2 weeks. I'm not doing anything other than wearing it all day, so I am thinking there is a quality issue. Googling dead display shows I'm not the only one with this problem. Until FitBit comes clean and then fixes the quality issue, I won't be recommending this.
customer_reviews.author: A. C. Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great tool for success
customer_reviews.text: I love how this little tool is having such a big impact on my life. I have gained weight over the past year and I realized from wearing this and charting my daily life (steps, food, water) that it's because I've been way too sedentary and eating too many carlories. This has really helped me get a handle on concrete, tangible daily goals. It doesn't feel like a gimmick, it feels like a lifestyle change. I'm three weeks in and I've convinced three co-workers, my Mom and my Dad all to buy one. It really helps to do this as part of a community, so I highly suggest you get at least one partner to do it with you.
customer_reviews.author: MargaretMillar

customer_reviews.title: I am a fitbit nerd!
customer_reviews.text: This is a reorder because I lost my first one which I had for six months. I cannot live without my fitbit stick and enjoy the details of the premium program I registered for to keep me in check with better healthy eating and exercise. It is the most motivational tool I have found for myself. I recommend fitbit to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nml

customer_reviews.title: Best little motivator!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is so motivating! With a little "good morning" or "get moving" message in the morning, it keeps track of all my activity throughout the day, and motivates me to reach new levels. It's syncs automatically with my computer when I'm just nearby and gives me more details about my activity levels. With that and 'my fitness' app on my phone, they work together to keep me 'honest' and help me reach my goals. I even walked around the house a dozen times one day when I was a few hundred steps short of my 20,000 step goal. A real motivator!!
customer_reviews.author: jdindayton

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about this tracker is that the company backs ...
customer_reviews.text: I use my Fitbit every day. The best thing about this tracker is that the company backs up its product and answers every question I have had. They treat you like an individual with whom they wish to continue to do business.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Luekens

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love
customer_reviews.text: I just Love the Fitbit! I makes me so much more aware of what I am eating and how much or little exercise I am getting. The data is right there in black and white...difficult to be in denial at that point. For me, the Fitbit is addicting...it is my obsession now. Difficult to explain unless you have one. If something happened to this Fitbit, I would buy another one. I don't feel that way about too many products.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: I love my Fitbit. Get one! It is compact and gives you a lot of feedback. Super easy to use and sleek design. Update: My fitbit housing has cracked after about six months and after filing a claim, the company is replacing it. Looks like the new design will help prevent this from happening. Superb Customer Service.
customer_reviews.author: L3rob

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves it it, No instructions
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 19 years old daughter for Christmas, she loves it, easy to set up online, she downloaded the app to her Iphone as well, however there were no instructions or explanations as to what the flower on the screne means or what to do for sleep mode. I guess she can look this information up online, she just had some questions that were not answered in the product packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmye Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Dead after less than 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: Did not even last long enough to loose it in the wash. This was the last one I ever bought.
customer_reviews.author: stuart hyde

customer_reviews.title: Fit Bit is Easy To Use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the FitBit for my wife for Christmas; she loves electronic gadgets and is constantly looking for efficient and effective means to monitor the impact of her dieting and exercise; the monitoring programs offered by the FitBit not only track her success but also provide feedback on the quantiy and quality of her sleep and only takes a few minutes each day to enter in data to produce the tracking results. Both she and I are highly satisfied with this product and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: A2ZReview

customer_reviews.title: Makes Tracking a Snap
customer_reviews.text: This was a great choice. It makes tracking my movement a snap. The online tools are excellent - including a really comprehensive selection of name brand food and restaurant dishes in the food tracking application – makes being honest about what you ate easy, LOL. Only one issue that I’ve had with it. The altimeter system that it uses for stairs just registers that I am going up and down in altitude – I commute across a bridge 5 days a week, so 5 days a week it registers 10 flights of stairs because of the height of the bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Louisiana Grammy

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on Mac
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking of buying one of these and planning to sync it to a Mac, be warned that it will NOT work -- i.e., won't sync to your computer. And because this company's so-called customer service is run by robots that spit out pre-programmed (and irrelevant) responses to questions, you will not get any help at all. But lots of people will sympathize with your plight on Facebook, because they have the same problem. My Fitbit is going where it belongs, which is in the trash. Thanks, Fitbit, for wasting $100 of my money.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it til it started to fall apart
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this and loved it at first. It was exciting to try to beat myself. But I sweat a lot and just my own sweat causes the fitbit to malfunction. Not only that but pieces of it have started falling off. Right now my fit bit is not working and i've only had it for about 2 months. It comes with a clip but the clip is awkward I don't want to use something if it feels awkward. So I love the concept but the actual product need a lot of work. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but easy to lose!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my wife. She was loving it! But, it slipped off her waistband, even with a leash, and it fell off while we were hiking. It's long gone. Maybe it would give an option for an "if lost" phone number for the display. Or, improve the next version with a more secure clip.
customer_reviews.author: PatC

customer_reviews.title: Motivation in a small easy-to-use package
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my fit bit. I tell everyone how much I love it and all about its functionality. I wear it all the time -- easily tracks steps, miles, floors, calories, sleep-tracking, etc. It is SUCH a good motivation to me to get feedback throughout my day about how active I've been. It keeps me going and makes me smile with the fun "chatter" :) Sync'ing and using the online profile was also a cinch to set up. The food log leaves a lot to be desired compared with others out there (ex. naan bread was not in their database). But it's still cool and I love using it!
customer_reviews.author: Emilia

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I had a lot of trouble syncing it to my computer so that I could retrieve my data. I contacted the help dept. several times and nothing they suggested worked. And if this wasn't bad enough, the device would randomly reset itself and lose all my data. This fitbit is going back ASAP!!!!
customer_reviews.author: L. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: mostly happy
customer_reviews.text: I love the fitbit itself. It's a great motivator and makes you very aware of the amount of exercise you should get vs what you actually do. I love that it logs everything from steps you take to stairs climbed and the amount of restful sleep you get each night. What is disappointing is that starting two days ago my fitbit doesn't sync to my computer and I can't figure out why not. Because fitbit has no phone support everything has to be done by email which is very labor intensive in terms of time waiting for answers. Meanwhile I am losing tracking data. If the kinks could be worked out this little piece of equipment would be perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought an jawbone UP! which broke with in a month. I read a review for the fitbit and thought I would try it. I have worn it every day for several months now. It keeps excellent track of my sleep and activity. The website is easy to use. Together they motivate me to increase my activity. I plan on purchasing one for my mother.
customer_reviews.author: Mary E.

product_meta.title: Fitbit Wireless Activity/Sleep Tracker, Black/Blue
product_meta.description:
Color:Black/BlueThe new Fitbit Ultra Wireless Activity Tracker makes every step you take a step toward better fitness, even on your busiest days. Like the original, the Ultra tracks your day down to details a pedometer can’t catch, giving you access to the exact steps you take, calories you burn and distance you travel, along with how long and how well you sleep. And now, with its altimeter technology, Fitbit can track the heart-healthy activity of climbing stairs, encouraging you to take the stairs not the elevator, or walking that hill. The Ultra also gives you more measures to track your fitness (a stair counter, a stopwatch, and fitness achievement badges), and more options (a clock, an iphone app, and new colors). Check your real time stats at any time with a quick glance at your tracker. It’s compact and discreet enough to wear all day long in your pocket, clipped to your waist, or even attached to your bra. Good sleep is another key to good health and weight loss, which is why Fitbit can also track your sleep. Simply slip your tracker inside the included wristband and you’ll see how long and how well you sleep. Fitbit wirelessly uploads your data to Fitbit.com whenever you’re within 15 feet of your computer. Works automatically -- no buttons to push, no data to enter. At Fitbit.com, free online tools show how your activity measures up over time and keep you motivated, with no monthly fee required. Track your progress with graphs, see how you compare to others, or compete with friends and family. Plus, you can use Fitbit.com or Fitbit’s new free iphone app to log what you eat from our database of over a 100,000 foods, or record workouts from activities like pilates, yoga, or cycling. The Fitbit ultra gives you a clear sense of how you’re doing and encourages you to be more active, because the more you know, the more motivated you’ll be. And these small changes can really add up: Fitbit users increase their daily steps by 43% and have lost an average of 13 lbs.

AMAZON.COM



The new Fitbit Ultra Wireless Activity Tracker makes every step you take a step toward better fitness, even on your busiest days. The Fitbit Ultra monitors your all-day activity to provide you with real-time feedback on steps, distance, calories burned, and stairs climbed to encourage you to walk more and be more active. It wirelessly uploads your data to Fitbit.com so you can gain deeper insight into your daily or monthly fitness and sleep levels with free online graphs and charts. On Fitbit.com, you can earn fitness badges, connect with friends to share and compete on fitness goals, or join the Fitbit community for advice and encouragement.








AT A GLANCE:

 * Tracks steps, distance, calories burned, and stairs climbed with a 3D accelerometer and altimeter
 * Measures how long and how well you sleep
 * Wirelessly uploads data to Fitbit.com
 * View charts and graphs for daily and monthly progress online or with the free
   iPhone app
 * Log food and workouts online and with iPhone app.
 * Access Food Goal, a weight management tools that dynamically changes targets based on daily activities
 * Small, discreet design fits into a pocket or clips to a belt or bra
 * Backed by a limited one-year warranty






Thanks to its compact design, this tracker can be easily tucked into a pocket or bra, or used with the included wristband.
View larger.



The Fitbit Ultra shows you how many steps you've taken, number of stairs climbed, and calories burned.
View larger.



Log onto Fitbit.com to keep track of your progress, workout goals, or create a fitness network. View larger.

TRACK ALL DAY ACTIVITY
Using a 3-D motion sensor, Fitbit Ultra tracks all the details about your daily activity that conventional pedometers would miss. When worn close to the body, this device tracks daily steps, number of stairs climbed, distance traveled, calories burned, and overall intensity of the activity level. Fitbit Ultra also contains an altimeter to track stairs or hills climbed. The compact design of the Tracker makes it easy to wear tucked into your pocket, clipped to a belt or bra all day.

TRACK YOUR SLEEP
You can also wear the Tracker at night with the included Fitbit wristband to monitor how long and how well you sleep. Fitbit Ultra will monitor when you fall asleep and how many times you woke up throughout the night to provide a sleep efficiency index.

ACHIEVE REAL RESULTS WITH FITBIT
Fitbit Ultra can help you reach your exercise, diet and overall wellness goals. In fact, Fitbit users increase their daily steps by 43 percent and have lost an average of 13 pounds.*

WIRELESSLY UPLOADS DATA TO FITBIT.COM
To help you gauge your progress, Fitbit Ultra wirelessly uploads your fitness data to Fitbit.com automatically whenever you're within 15 feet of your computer--no need to take time out of your busy day to enter stats.

TRACK YOUR FITNESS TRENDS AND GOALS ONLINE
At Fitbit.com, you'll enjoy free online tools that show how your activity measures up over time and keep you motivated, with no monthly fee required. Your dashboard quickly shows you how close you are to achieving your weekly goals on calories burned, steps taken, and other fitness goals.

Fitbit makes fitness fun by translating your real accomplishments into real life examples. For instance, tracking that you've climbed 22 floors is the same as climbing to the top of the Statue of Liberty. To keep you motivated, you can earn badges for daily and lifetime fitness activities.

SOCIAL AND COMMUNITY TOOLS FOR ENCOURAGEMENT
Invite friends through email or through Facebook to connect on Fitbit.com to build a fitness network. Set collaborative or competitive challenges together, or tap into the growing Fitbit.com community to access tips and receive encouragement. With Fitbit, it's like working out with a group of virtual friends every day.

LOG FOOD AND WORKOUTS
You can build a complete picture of your overall fitness by logging foods and workouts. The Fitbit database has over a 100,000 specific food items for you to select from. Enter workout specifics from yoga, Pilates, elliptical workouts, boot camp, spinning, kickboxing, and even Wii games from the workout database. Fitbit's Food Goal feature shows you the range of calories you should stick to every day to reach your weight loss goals, and dynamically adjusts based on your day's activities. You can also track your weight and other health indicators like blood pressure, glucose, and heart rate.



Click each image to view a different Fitbit online tool

FREE MOBILE TOOLS

With our mobile website and our free iPhone App, you'll be able to log workouts, food, water, weight, and much more, plus check your stats while on the go. Log workouts and food even when offline, so no detail gets forgotten.

INTEGRATES WITH OTHER APPS
Fitbit can also integrate with many nutrition and fitness apps to make it easy to sync your stats with programs such as LoseIt!, RunKeeper, and Microsoft HealthVault.

The Fitbit Ultra Wireless Activity Tracker is backed by a manufacturer's limited one-year parts and labor warranty.
